p: The existence of ADE in SARS‐CoV‐2 might aggravate the COVID‐19 pandemic with higher morbidity and mortality, when convalescent patients will encounter infections in the future by possibly mutated strains ( 44, 45). However, the evidence for distinct types or strains in the present stage of evolution of SARS‐CoV‐2, which could account for differences in morbidity and RBD binding affinity, is conflicting ( 48).
